entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #14
entry.content:
Summer is here for sure and the heat reminds us daily of the contrast of Kansas seasons. We had a brief reprieve with some cooler temperatures earlier in June. Thankfully there has been some rain recently which has helped quell the otherwise persistent heat. Alright, so weather not withstanding, what‚Äôs going on in July with KC Tech Group? We‚Äôre covering ZeroMQ in all of its patriotic glory this month! That‚Äôs right, just because July 4th is on Wednesday doesn‚Äôt mean we‚Äôre resting easy. üòé

ZeroMQ is a distributed messaging infrastructure that you can add to your application with relative ease. Learn more about it by reviewing the Learn the Basics section of their website. There are even some nice videos there to bring up into context quickly. However, one great way to learn more about it is to join the discussion at our next Meeting of the Minds session this Thursday! We‚Äôve reserved space at Third Space Coffee House so you can enjoy some tasty coffee, dinner and/or snacks while learning about ZeroMQ!

Also, don‚Äôt forget about our monthly raffle of a free license to one of JetBrains great products!



If you‚Äôre a fan of great tools that really help increase your productivity and efficiency, JetBrains is definitely one to check out. We thank them for sponsoring KC Tech Group!

That‚Äôs it for now. We look forward to seeing you and hope you can join the discussion at Meeting of the Minds #14! See you there! Happy Coding! üßê

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #13
entry.content:
The growing season has been a little late this year and it feels a bit like we may have skipped Spring straight over to Summer üî• here in Kansas, but I think I‚Äôm happier with the cold having moved on. The wind has also calmed itself more lately. However, since I can‚Äôt resist a good pun, the winds of change are still strong at work and that certainly helps us consider new and improved ways of deploying some of our applications! <‚Äì Great segway, yeah? üòÜ ü§ì

The topic for June‚Äôs Meeting of the Minds session is Heroku, and yours truly will be doing the presentation. I‚Äôve been intrigued by Heroku and its offerings since I became enamoured with container computing more than a year ago. Lately I‚Äôve actually been putting it to good use deploying some MkDocs solutions for customer review. We‚Äôll be reviewing at least the core offering (there is a lot more under the Heroku umbrella) at MotM-13 with some discussion and application demos. At MotM-12, we discussed the plans for this upcoming session and mentioned a Modbus simulator as a good demo app to implement and deploy via Heroku. If you have any other application suggestions (remember, these will be demos! üòÄ) please join us in the discussion over in our Slack group or leave a comment below.

I‚Äôm pretty excited to demonstrate how even the free tier of Heroku can be used to host some great application content. It isn‚Äôt just about web pages either‚Äìour Modbus simulator will be emulating remote device behavior, and our documentation demo is a great way to host documentation packages. Combine these with a custom domain name integrations and you can have a pretty broad set of functionality without much hosting upkeep! I look forward to some wonderful brainstorming on this during next month‚Äôs session.

If I haven‚Äôt just completely convinced you to drop by yet, don‚Äôt forget that each month we raffle off a free license to one of JetBrains‚Äô amazing developer tool offerings! We‚Äôre very happy to have them as a continuing sponsor of our group. Come by and take advantage with a chance to leverage their productivity enhancing IDE‚Äôs or refactor/linting tools.



Finally, we‚Äôre looking for more discussion topics for future sessions, so please let us know if you have interest in a particular discussion topic. I‚Äôve updated our Mindmap with some more topic ideas‚Äìlet‚Äôs build that list out even more and get some folks lined up to dive in on these!

That‚Äôs all I have for now. Enjoy the weather everyone, don‚Äôt forget to go outside and do a little analog processing; all the same, happy coding as well! üòé

‚ÄìKevin Collins

UPDATE: As it turned out during preparing materials for this MotM, Heroku is really just for deploying web applications. It supports WebSockets, but you can‚Äôt deploy an application that listens on an arbitrary TCP socket‚Äìsomething that you need if you‚Äôre going to perform device simulation as my hopes outlined above. As we discussed during the session, you can have what are called ‚Äúworker‚Äù dynos to perform background tasks, but they won‚Äôt be reachable externally. Thanks to those who made it out, and we‚Äôre all looking forward to a great rest of 2018, to be continued with a session on ZeroMQ in July!

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #12
entry.content:
Spring seems to have sprung for the most part üå∑üöú‚ÄìI‚Äôve had to mow my lawn, so I think that counts. Meeting of the Minds is off to the races for 2018 and we‚Äôve got a great framework to take a look at. The Qt Framework (pronounced ‚Äúcute‚Äù) has grown considerably since the last time I was pseudo-familiar with it. I remember it from back in the days of the GNOME vs KDE battles on the Linux Desktop. GNOME used the GTK+ graphical toolkit, and KDE used Qt. Taking a peek at things lately yields the realization that a LOT has happened since those early days.



It‚Äôs all about consistent multi-platform development, across a wide range of use-cases, much more than just single desktop and mobile applications. Vehicles, refrigerators, automation, and more! Feel free to check out the Qt website for some additional overview content, but what better than some real-world demos, feedback, and discussion? We‚Äôll be hearing from Alec Weaver, who has been working with the platform to create some interesting applications. I‚Äôm looking forward to a great session and some great discussions about how Qt might be able to be applied.

Join us on Thursday, May 3rd at 6:30pm in Bonner Springs at Third Space Coffee. Feel free to come by a little beforehand to get a tasty coffee or snack and chat about things tech and otherwise‚Äìthere is a nice deck out back as well to enjoy the nice evening weather.

I‚Äôd like to take a moment to give a shout out to our continued sponsor for 2018, JetBrains, who has been generous to offer us licenses to their extensive collection of IDE‚Äôs and other tools as offerings in our monthly raffle.



We‚Äôre always looking for some additional topic ideas, so please feel free to send us a note via our MotM Topic Submission Form! Thanks as always and Happy Coding!

‚ÄìKevin Collins
entry.summary: Spring seems to have sprung for the most part üå∑üöú‚ÄìI‚Äôve had to mow my lawn, so I think that counts. Meeting of the Minds is off to the r

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #11
entry.content:
Though it looks as though we might be in for a chilly Easter, things are generally warming and and we‚Äôre starting to see some green on the ground. We‚Äôre getting close to our next MotM session about The Things Network, which should yield some pretty interesting discussion! Our presenter this month attended the first The Things Network Conference in Amsterdam this year and has a lot of great insight into the underlying LoRaWAN technology driving one of the many waves of the so-called Internet of Things (IoT).

I‚Äôm hoping we can build more on some of the great discussions we had during MotM-10. Part of what makes Meeting of the Minds interesting is not just the tech itself but the insights from everyone regarding how it can be applied (and also, sometimes, the why). LoRaWAN, one of a few emerging Low-Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) technologies, has some unique properties that enable some fascinating possibilities for sensor deployments. I‚Äôm sure everyone will have some neat ideas to chat about.

We‚Äôll be meeting again on Thursday, April 5th at 6:30pm in Bonner Springs at Third Space Coffee. We‚Äôve reserved the conference room for 6:30pm, but we usually gather before than‚Äìafter all, there is great coffee and tasty bits to be had there. Come a little earlier to get things going even sooner!



In 2018, we‚Äôre continuing to raffle off a license to one of JetBrains‚Äô wonderful IDE‚Äôs. If you end up working with Python at all, it is difficult to match the features and functionality of their PyCharm environment. They‚Äôve got a bunch of great products, but I couldn‚Äôt help mentioning PyCharm after having it really help me out a lot over the past months. It continues to be great to have their support for KC Tech Group.

Have a great Easter and happy coding!

‚ÄìKevin Collins
entry.summary: Though it looks as though we might be in for a chilly Easter, things are generally warming and and we‚Äôre starting to see some green on th

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #10
entry.content:
We‚Äôre back in the swing of things for 2018, looking forward to Spring! üå± üå∑ Since we‚Äôre not quite there yet, I‚Äôll try and keep your mind busy with the next Meeting of the Minds topic for March! Vehicles today are more advanced than ever with sophisticated chassis control, automated driving aids, and even more fuel efficient drivetrains. More and more of the components whose only possibility for improvement depended on turning a wrench or swapping out parts can now be customized through changing some bits in the ever-growing number of computerized controllers that are onboard.

Alright, alright, so we‚Äôre going to learn how to adjust fuel injection parameters and spark advance curves? Nope, instead we‚Äôre going to focus on an area of vehicle customization that has been out of reach in times past. General Motors (and perhaps others) now offers a development SDK for creating custom applications that run on the built-in touchscreen infotainment systems in newer cars. Best of all, you develop these applications using open technologies such as Node.js! üòé Check it out on their site for Next Generation Infotainment.

Join us at 6:30pm on March 1st, 2018 in the Conference Room at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS. I‚Äôll be giving a demo of this system along with a proof-of-concept application (source code will be available on our Github page afterwards). It should be an entertaining (that part is on me) presentation and discussion (this part is partially on all of you), so come and join the fun!



We‚Äôre also back in action with our sponsor for Meeting of the Minds, JetBrains s.r.o.. We have a drawing each session for a free license to one of their great IDE‚Äôs or development tools. You should really check them out‚Äìespecially if you want to get your dev on. üòâ

Alright, I better get to coding.

‚ÄìKevin Collins
entry.summary: We‚Äôre back in the swing of things for 2018, looking forward to Spring! üå± üå∑ Since we‚Äôre not quite there yet, I‚Äôll try and keep your min

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #9
entry.content:
Rested üò¥ and refreshed üòå, KC Tech Group‚Äôs Meeting of the Minds (MotM) sessions are back for 2018! We‚Äôre kicking things off with a presentation on Jupyter Notebook. This interesting project gives you a way to combine all sorts of content including live code from multiple languages, documentation, and interactive visualizations as well!

Rather than spill all the beans, let‚Äôs just plan on stopping by Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS at 6:30pm on Thursday, February 8th for some great coffee, company, and tech discussion!

We‚Äôll be continuing our raffle for a JetBrains s.r.o. product license in 2018, so if you‚Äôre at all interested in their great developer tools and products, this is a great way to possibly win a free license! Even if you don‚Äôt, check out their community offerings that are available free of charge! It has been great to have JetBrains‚Äô support for our group and we‚Äôre happy to welcome them back as a sponsor for 2018.



We‚Äôve got some other MotM topics lined up for 2018, let us know through our Slack group if you‚Äôve got some other ideas or would like to do a presentation! So far, here are some of the topics on our radar:

  • The Things Network
  • Block-chain Technology and Cryptocurrency üí∞
  • your topic idea here ü§®

I‚Äôm looking forward to keeping things going in 2018. Happy Coding!! üòé

‚ÄìKevin Collins
entry.summary: Rested üò¥ and refreshed üòå, KC Tech Group‚Äôs Meeting of the Minds (MotM) sessions are back for 2018! We‚Äôre kicking things off wi

entry.title: Closing Out 2017
entry.content:
As the year closes out, I think we all enjoy reflecting a bit on our achievements and accomplishments the past year brought us. 2017 saw, among a great many other things, the introduction of KC Technology Group. Our trademark-worthy ‚ÄúMeeting of the Minds‚Äù sessions have been a forum for gathering and discussing various technology topics, industry trends, and whatever else may be on, well, our minds. üòú I‚Äôve very much enjoyed getting a chance to be introduced to some of the various projects out there in the wild. It has also been great to hear about topics that everyone is passionate about.

We‚Äôre taking a brief respite in January, with our next Meeting of the Minds session targeted for Thursday, February 8th, 2018, so lets look back at 2017 and see what we covered‚Ä¶

2017 Meeting of the Minds

  • MotM-1 - First Session! GPIO access methodologies on Raspberry Pi!
  • MotM-2 - Source Control
  • MotM-3 - Static Site Generators
  • MotM-4 - Communication Protocols
  • MotM-5 - Node-RED
  • MotM-6 - Home Assistant
  • MotM-7 - Text Editors, Regular Expressions, and Ignition Community Conference 2017
  • MotM-8 - Hilscher NetPI and Docker

We also began, at MotM-7, a new intro series called ‚ÄúPass the Mic‚Äù. Kicking off the meeting, everyone gets a chance to briefly mention something that has caught there attention recently. We‚Äôve got some interesting hits so far and are looking forward to continuing this in 2018 with some better capture and follow-up on the website! Let‚Äôs take a look at what we‚Äôve covered so far:

2017 Pass the Mic

  • Informational Dashboard Design üì± - (link to Stephen Few‚Äôs website here)
  • Blockchain Technology and Cryptocurrency üí∞
  • Sensor Clouds and Wide-Area Radio Networks ‚òÅÔ∏è
  • Wonderware OI Gateway and MQTT Support üîó
  • Windows (Server 2016 and Windows 10) Container Support

I think 2018 will be another exciting year. More and more interesting technologies continue to emerge, even more existine ones continue to mature and see increased popularity. One of the things I love about this group is that we can collectively discover and shed light on more of these fascinating developments that we might not have time for on our own. Join our Slack group (or hop on there if you haven‚Äôt been there in a while) and help us lay out some topics to dive in on in 2018! We need volunteers for presentations! You needn‚Äôt be the undisputed expert on a given topic‚Äìwhat we‚Äôre looking for is some time spent putting together an introduction and demonstration so that we can all discover something new and learn a bit about how to get started.

I also don‚Äôt want to close out 2017 without thanking our sponsor, JetBrains. Their generous support has enabled us to share some great tools with our community and add some extra incentive for folks to gather and talk technology! Thank you so much JetBrains for all you do and your wonderful support of KC Tech Group. Let‚Äôs give them a hand (üëè)and check out some of their great products via the link below!



We‚Äôll plan to see everyone in February‚Äìlet‚Äôs have a great 2018 full of discovery, learning, and community.

Happy Coding. üíª üòé üññ

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #8
entry.content:
ü¶É Turkey Day is over and I‚Äôm certainly a bit sluggish after eating way too much over the holiday! Thanksgiving is a great time to reflect about some of the things that we‚Äôre thankful for though, and while family and friends definitely rank highest on my list, I find myself thankful for some of the great technologies we get to interact with and leverage from day to day.

For MotM-8, we‚Äôll continue discovering (together!) some of the latest and greatest trends in computing and automation. We‚Äôve got a sneak peak at Hilscher‚Äôs NetPi platform as well as an introduction to some of the technologies it is using. We‚Äôve covered Node-RED in the past (MotM-5), and this time around I‚Äôll be giving an introduction to Docker and container technology. Sure, you can go through the Getting Started guide on Docker‚Äôs website, but why not enjoy some tasty coffee and dinner at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS (directions are on their website) while I help distill it down! We‚Äôre getting started with the official stuff at 6:30pm on Thursday, December 7th, 2017, but feel free to come early for food and conversation!



I‚Äôd like to thank JetBrains s.r.o. for their continued support of KC Tech Group! I hope to have some of our members reflect in one of the next meetings on some of the projects they‚Äôre working on with the JetBrains tools. We‚Äôre going to be raffling off a license to one of JetBrains‚Äô incredible IDEs/development tools at MotM-8! Check out their site for some of their other community offerings, they‚Äôve got some great ways to get started with some great new technologies.

Don‚Äôt forget to join us on our Slack group! See you in December, happy coding! üëª

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #7
entry.content:
üéÉ As we get ready for Halloween, we sometimes reflect on things that are scary or frightening. Change is one of those things that can sometimes be scary, but many times, we find ourselves in a much better place after conquering that initial resistence and learning something new.

There has been a lot of movement in the world of text editors in recent times, and MotM-7 is ready to share some of the changes with you. We‚Äôll also be touching on regular expressions, which have been around for a long time, but are worth looking at while you‚Äôre playing with your new text editor. üòé

Mike Wickersheim and I will be teaming up on a double header to deliver a presentation on modern Text Editor options and the power of Regular Expressions along with a summary of the Ignition Community Conference 2017 last month! Join us and talk tech at 6:30pm on Thursday, November 2nd, 2017 at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS (directions are on their website). They‚Äôve been offering some pretty amazing soups recently, so come early to endulge (and leverage a tasty cup of coffee to stay awake during our sure-to-be-exhilerating presentation üòâ).



I‚Äôd like to thank JetBrains s.r.o. for their continued support of KC Tech Group! I hope to have some of our members reflect in one of the next meetings on some of the projects they‚Äôre working on with the JetBrains tools. We‚Äôre going to be raffling off a license to one of JetBrains‚Äô incredible IDEs/development tools at MotM-7! Check out their site for some of their other community offerings, they‚Äôve got some great ways to get started with some great new technologies.

Don‚Äôt forget to join us on our Slack group! See you in November, happy coding! üëª

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #6
entry.content:
Fall is here! üçÉüçÅüçÇ We touched on some great points in MotM-5, but we‚Äôre pushing that even further with a deeper look at Home Automation, specifically Home Assistant with a presentation by Alec Weaver (@aweaver on our Slack group). This product is a free and open way to integrate some of the smart devices out there in the marketplace, and Alec has some great demos lined up to help get you started!

It is an exciting time in this area, as we see a lot of different products and strategies emerge. I think this is an area that will see a lot more attention in the next couple of years. I‚Äôm not sure how any one of us can keep up on all of it ourselves‚Äìthis is when we need to engage our community. Join ours and talk tech with us at 6:30pm on October 5th, 2017 at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS (directions are on their website). Come early and get some dinner and wonderful coffee!



I‚Äôd like to thank JetBrains s.r.o. for their continued support of KC Tech Group!

Join us for a chance to join our raffle for a free license to one of JetBrains‚Äô incredible IDEs or development tools! Also, check out their site for some of their other community offerings, they‚Äôve got some great ways to get started with some great new technologies.

We look forward to seeing you! Until then, happy coding! üòé

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #5
entry.content:
Summer is nearing a close, but there is still a lot to look forward to as Fall starts to move in. One such great thing is Node-RED, which happens to be the topic of Meeting of the Minds #5! We‚Äôll be covering Node-RED which has superb applications for almost everyone. Automating some of your home automation gadgets, simulating device behaviors, connecting disparate systems, and much more all fall under the capabilities of a Node-RED system.

Eric Crook (@ecrook on our Slack group) has volunteered to give us a presentation on Node-RED and shine some light on its capabilities and reveal some of its more common use-cases. With it being able to run on commodity hardware as well as powerful server-grade machines, everyone can explore Node-RED and find their own uses for it. Feel free to bring your Raspberry Pi and we‚Äôll help get Node-RED up and running for you after the presentation!



I‚Äôd like to thank JetBrains s.r.o. for their continued support of KC Tech Group!

Join us for a chance to join our raffle for a free license to one of JetBrains‚Äô incredible IDEs or development tools! Also, check out their site for some of their other community offerings, they‚Äôve got some great ways to get started with some great new technologies.

We‚Äôll see you at 6:30pm on September 7th at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS:

Until then‚Ä¶ Happy coding! üòé

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #4
entry.content:
It‚Äôs HOT üî• here in Kansas! Thankfully that won‚Äôt dissuade hungry minds from gobbling up great information about Communications Protocols in Meeting of the Minds #4! This session will introduce you to some protocols that you might not have explored yet as well as peeling back the onion on some ones you might not have realized had such potential!

Returning to Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs on August 3rd, 2017, we‚Äôll start the meeting in the conference room at 6:30pm. Many folks enjoyed some tasty food before/during MotM-3, so feel free to come out and enjoy a bite and/or some delicious coffee ahead of time (they‚Äôll give ya decaf too if you‚Äôd like given the evening schedule ‚òïÔ∏è)!



Mike and I are also happy to thank JetBrains s.r.o. for their support of KC Tech Group! MotM-3 was our first raffle for a license to one of JetBrains‚Äô amazing development tools. Jim Evers hasn‚Äôt let us know which product he‚Äôs picked, but I‚Äôm sure there will be one that will enable some pretty neat new code to be constructed! It is super great to have such generous support from JetBrains

Happy coding! üòé

‚ÄìKevin Collins

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #3
entry.content:
We‚Äôre back for another Meeting of the Minds! MotM-3 will gather on July 6th, 2017 at 6:30pm (feel free to come early to get coffee and food, folks will start arriving around 6pm) at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS.

Our last MotM session at Third Space was quite delightful. There will be food available (they have a wonderful menu!) and possibly some pie too üç∞.

We‚Äôve still got some work to do on the topic voting‚Äìwe‚Äôre certainly up for volunteers until we land on something concrete! For this session, we‚Äôre going to fall back on one of my more favorite recent topics. You guessed it: Static Site Generators. I really think this will be an exciting session‚ÄìI‚Äôll be demoing a few different systems and I‚Äôm expecting a lot of folks to have light bulbs going off! You‚Äôll be able to do some pretty neat things after this one!

As we get closer, I‚Äôll post a link to some resources for the presentation. If you haven‚Äôt done it yet, don‚Äôt forget to join us in Slack!

Happy coding! üòé

‚ÄìKevin Collins

Third Space Coffee:

entry.title: Meeting of the Minds #2
entry.content:
It is time for another Meeting of the Minds! MotM-2 will be held on June 5th, 2017 at 6:30pm at Third Space Coffee House in Bonner Springs, KS:

This will be our first gathering here, but I can assert that they have great food, exceptional coffee, and a wonderful atmosphere! The presentation topic, chosen at the last MotM session, will be Source Control. We‚Äôll be covering the basics as well as demoing both Git and Subversion across a few platforms. We might even offer up a surprise (at least to me!) entry in the Source Control world that I hadn‚Äôt run into before! In addition to some introductory content, I hope to share a few tips and tricks that will benefit both beginner and advanced users!

I‚Äôve got the presentation assembled (at least the Keynote content, you‚Äôll have to come in person to see the demos), feel free to join the presentation live here (although until we work out some additional live video streaming goodness, it might not be that exciting):

https://www.icloud.com/keynote-live/sc:0Q1HS420lixvG81dldqU97DKkdh1Se2wL_q29M7XiO5VY1ZJQr5Y262Y9cqJOF9vkoR

Have a great week, and happy coding!

‚ÄìKevin Collins
entry.summary: It is time for another Meeting of the Minds! MotM-2 will be held on June 5th, 2017 at 6:30pm at

entry.title: Welcome to the KC Tech Group!
entry.content: Welcome to the Kansas City Technology Group! We are a group of technology and automation enthusiasts that meet periodically to discover new gadgets, tech, software, and more! We‚Äôre just getting some things rolling, so stay tuned for more content and information soon.
